author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Madras High Court Bench here has refused to entertain a contempt of court application against University Grants Commission Secretary Jaspal Singh Sandhu, Higher Education Secretary Apoorva, Director of Collegiate Education K. Sekar, Manonmanian Sundaranar University Vice-Chancellor K. Baskar and its Registrar A. John De Britto.

A Division Bench of Justices S. Manikumar and R. Mahadevan dismissed the application right at the admission stage after observing that another Division Bench had only directed the five officials to consider a representation made by the contempt applicant, S. Jedidiah Sathya, and did not issue a “positive direction” as sought by him in a writ petition filed in 2013.

Disposing of the petition on September 9 last, the Division Bench of Justices R. Sudhakar and V.M. Velumani had refused to direct the officials to restrain two private colleges in Thoothukudi district from claiming religious minority status besides forbearing them from disbursing educational grant to those institutions.

The Bench, however, directed them to consider the petitioner’s representation.
title: Contempt plea against UGC Secretary dismissed
